ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: or his family who sheltered him
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And his family who had stood by him,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and his kinsfolk who had stood by him,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: his kinsmen who gave him refuge (from hardship)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And the family in which he was.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And his Fasilah who sheltered him,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And the nearest of his kinsfolk who gave him shelter,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And his kin that harboured him
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and his kinsfolk who gave him shelter,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And his kin that sheltered him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: his kin, which had sheltered him
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And his kindred who sheltered him,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: the kinsmen who gave him shelter,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And his family that sheltered him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And his nearest kindred who shelter him
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [70:13] and his kin, his clan ([expressed as fasīla] because he is a [detached] part [fasl] of it) that had sheltered him, embraced him,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And his kin) and his clan and relatives (that harboured him) to whom he belongs
